test_questions.question: What was BMO's adjusted earnings per share for Q2 2025?
test_questions.answer: BMO reported adjusted earnings per share of $2.62 for Q2 2025.
test_questions.quote: In the quarter, adjusted net income and earnings per share were $2.62, respectively, with PPPT growth of 12%
test_questions.speaker: Darryl White (CEO)

test_questions.question: Tell me about CIBC's performance in the second quarter of fiscal year 2025
test_questions.answer: CIBC reported strong Q2 2025 performance with adjusted EPS of $2.05, net income of $2 billion, ROE of 13.9%, and 19% pre-provision pretax earnings growth. The bank achieved positive operating leverage and maintained a healthy CET1 ratio of 13.4%.
test_questions.quote: We delivered net income of $2 billion and earnings per share of $2.05, both up 17% from the prior year. Pre-provision pretax earnings were up 19%, supported by broad-based growth across all of our operating units and another strong quarter of operating leverage. Our return on equity was 13.9%, which is up 50 basis points year-over-year, coupled with a healthy CET1 ratio of 13.4%.
test_questions.speaker: Victor Dodig (CEO)

test_questions.question: What synergies did National Bank realize from the CWB acquisition in 2025 Q2?
test_questions.answer: National Bank realized $27 million in cost and funding synergies from the CWB acquisition in Q2 2025, and is targeting $270 million in total synergies by the end of fiscal 2027.
test_questions.quote: The realized cost and funding synergies of $27 million in Q2 represents $115 million on an annual basis, which equates to approximately 43% of our three year target.
test_questions.speaker: Marie Gingras (CFO)

test_questions.question: RBC FY2025 Q2 capital ratio?
test_questions.answer: RBC's Common Equity Tier 1 (CET1) ratio was 13.2% in Q2 FY2025.
test_questions.quote: We ended the quarter with a common equity tier 1 ratio of 13.2%
test_questions.speaker: Dave McKay (CEO)

test_questions.question: How much did Scotiabank increase its dividend in the April 2025 quarter?
test_questions.answer: Scotiabank increased its quarterly dividend by $0.04 to $1.10 per share in Q2 2025 (quarter ended April 30, 2025).
test_questions.quote: We announced a return to growth of our quarterly dividends, increasing our quarterly dividend by $0.04 to $1.10 per share.
test_questions.speaker: Scott Thomson (CEO)

test_questions.question: TD Bank Q2/25 restructuring charges and expected savings?
test_questions.answer: TD Bank expects restructuring charges of $600-700 million to achieve annual run-rate savings of $550-650 million from its restructuring program announced in Q2 2025.
test_questions.quote: We incurred restructuring charges of $163 million pretax this quarter and expect to incur total restructuring charges of $600 million to $700 million pretax over the next several quarters. The restructuring program is expected to generate savings of approximately $100 million pretax in fiscal 2025 and annual run rate savings of $550 million to $650 million pretax.
test_questions.speaker: Kelvin Tran (CFO)

test_questions.question: What was Bank of Montreal's revenue growth year-to-date in fiscal 2025?
test_questions.answer: Bank of Montreal (BMO) reported 13% year-to-date revenue growth in fiscal 2025.
test_questions.quote: For the first half of the year, EPS grew 10%, driven by year-to-date revenue growth of 13%...ROE improved to 10.6% year-to-date.
test_questions.speaker: Darryl White (CEO)

test_questions.question: How many new retail primary clients did Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce add in 2Q25?
test_questions.answer: CIBC added over 500,000 net new personal clients over the last 12 months ending Q2 2025.
test_questions.quote: Our strategic investments, including in our exclusive partnerships are driving client acquisition and in our targeted segments, adding over 0.5 million net new personal clients over the last 12 months.
test_questions.speaker: Rob Sedran (CFO)

test_questions.question: National Bank's Financial Markets earnings second quarter twenty twenty-five
test_questions.answer: National Bank's Financial Markets segment reported net income of over $500 million in Q2 2025, benefiting from market volatility.
test_questions.quote: Financial markets generated net income of more than $500 million this quarter, with net income growth in the first half of the year, well ahead of the expectations we had coming into 2025.
test_questions.speaker: Laurent Ferreira (CEO)

test_questions.question: Royal Bank performing reserves build Q2 FY25
test_questions.answer: Royal Bank (RBC) built $568 million in performing reserves in Q2 FY2025 to prepare for economic uncertainty.
test_questions.quote: we took a total of $568 million or 23 basis points of provisions on performing loans this quarter...This marks the 12th consecutive quarter where we added reserves and performing loans resulting in a total ACL of $7.5 billion.
test_questions.speaker: Graeme Hepworth (CRO)

test_questions.question: BNS Scene+ loyalty program metrics in 2025 second quarter?
test_questions.answer: Bank of Nova Scotia (Scotiabank) reported that Scene+ has 15 million members, with 26% holding a payment product, as of Q2 2025.
test_questions.quote: We are also seeing traction in our card strategy with almost 26% of the 15 million Scene+ members now holding a payment product. Scene+ members are seeing the value of the loyalty program as key metrics such as active users, point issuances and redemptions grew year-over-year.
test_questions.speaker: Scott Thomson (CEO)

test_questions.question: Toronto-Dominion AML spending fiscal 2025
test_questions.answer: TD Bank is spending approximately $500 million annually on AML remediation efforts and is on track with implementation as of Q2 2025.
test_questions.quote: We continue to expect US BSA/AML remediation and related governance and control investments of approximately $500 million pretax in fiscal 2025. We expect similar investments in fiscal 2026.
test_questions.speaker: Leo Salom (President and CEO, TD Bank)

test_questions.question: BMO Q2-25 US net interest margin expansion
test_questions.answer: BMO's US Personal & Commercial Banking (USP&C) segment achieved net interest margin expansion of 5 basis points in Q2 2025.
test_questions.quote: USP and C NIM increased five basis points as our deposit optimization activity led to higher margins that more than offset the impact of lower deposit balances.
test_questions.speaker: Tayfun Tuzun (CFO)

test_questions.question: CIBC U.S. Capital Markets revenue growth year-over-year Q2/2025
test_questions.answer: CIBC's U.S. region Capital Markets revenue increased 37% year-over-year in Q2 2025.
test_questions.quote: Our U.S. footprint continues to expand across our bank as well including U.S. region Capital markets revenue, which is up 37% from the prior year.
test_questions.speaker: Victor Dodig (CEO)

test_questions.question: What is NBC's target ROE for fiscal year 2025?
test_questions.answer: National Bank targets an adjusted ROE of approximately 15% for fiscal year 2025.
test_questions.quote: However, excluding this amortization and supported by our strong first half performance, we remain confident in delivering mid single-digits EPS growth and adjusted ROE of approximately 15% for the year.
test_questions.speaker: Marie Gingras (CFO)

test_questions.question: RBC wealth management AUA growth Canada vs US Q2 2025
test_questions.answer: RBC's Wealth Management reported Assets Under Administration (AUA) growth of 11% in Canada and 9% in the US in Q2 2025.
test_questions.quote: Moving to Wealth Management, where we reported assets under administration growth of 11% in Canada and 9% in the U.S.
test_questions.speaker: Dave McKay (CEO)

test_questions.question: Scotia's international banking ROE and productivity ratio 2Q/25
test_questions.answer: Scotiabank's International Banking division showed improved performance with a productivity ratio of 51% in Q2 2025, contributing to overall ROE improvement.
test_questions.quote: Moving to International Banking, earnings were $681 million, driven by another quarter of strong expense discipline and lower impaired loan loss provisions. Return on equity improved both year-over-year and quarter-over-quarter as earnings grew, while capital attributed was lower. Our productivity ratio improved to 51%
test_questions.speaker: Scott Thomson (CEO)

test_questions.question: TD wholesale banking revenue record Q2 twenty-twenty-five
test_questions.answer: TD's Wholesale Banking achieved record revenue of $2.1 billion in Q2 2025.
test_questions.quote: In Wholesale Banking, we continue to demonstrate the power of our broader platform with record revenue of $2.1 billion.
test_questions.speaker: Raymond Chun (CEO)

test_questions.question: Bank of Montreal VIP Porter loyalty cards added Q2/FY25
test_questions.answer: BMO added over 10,000 new VIP Porter loyalty cards in Q2 FY2025.
test_questions.quote: For example, we've added over 10,000 new VIP Porter loyalty cards in the first six weeks since the launch of our partnership with Canada's fastest-growing airline.
test_questions.speaker: Darryl White (CEO)

test_questions.question: CIBC's use of AI in commercial banking operations second quarter 2025
test_questions.answer: CIBC's AI platform has saved team members an estimated 200,000 hours during a successful pilot and is now rolling out across the entire organization in Q2 2025.
test_questions.quote: Our technology investments are paying off, including our CIBC AI platform, which has saved our team members and estimated 200,000 hours during a successful pilot and is now rolling out across our entire organization.
test_questions.speaker: Victor Dodig (CEO)

test_questions.question: Compare BMO and TD's CET1 ratios for Q2 2025
test_questions.answer: In Q2 2025, TD had a higher CET1 ratio at 14.9% compared to BMO's 13.5%, with TD maintaining one of the strongest capital positions among Canadian banks.
test_questions.quote: Our capital position remains robust with a CET1 ratio of 13.5% (BMO) | As of quarter-end, the bank's CET1 ratio was 14.9% (TD)
test_questions.speaker: Darryl White (CEO, BMO) / Raymond Chun (CEO, TD)

test_questions.question: Which Canadian banks announced dividend increases in fiscal Q2 2025 and by how much?
test_questions.answer: In Q2 2025, four banks announced dividend increases: BMO increased by $0.04 (5% increase), RBC by $0.06 (4% increase), Scotiabank by $0.04 to $1.10 per share, and National Bank by $0.04.
test_questions.quote: today we announced an increase in our dividend of four cents, up 5% from last year (BMO) | we announced a $0.06 or 4% increase in our quarterly dividend (RBC) | increasing our quarterly dividend by $0.04 to $1.10 per share (Scotiabank) | we also raised our quarterly dividend by $0.04 effective next quarter (NBC)
test_questions.speaker: Darryl White (BMO) / Dave McKay (RBC) / Scott Thomson (Scotiabank) / Laurent Ferreira (NBC)

test_questions.question: Compare CIBC and National Bank ROE second quarter twenty-twenty-five
test_questions.answer: National Bank achieved a higher ROE of 15.6% compared to CIBC's 13.9% in Q2 2025, with NBC reporting the highest ROE among Canadian banks that quarter.
test_questions.quote: Our return on equity was 13.9%, which is up 50 basis points year-over-year (CIBC) | return on equity of 15.6% (National Bank)
test_questions.speaker: Victor Dodig (CEO, CIBC) / Laurent Ferreira (CEO, National Bank)

test_questions.question: How are RBC and Scotiabank approaching share buybacks in Q2/25?
test_questions.answer: In Q2 2025, both banks announced new share buyback programs: RBC announced a new NCIB to repurchase up to 35 million common shares, while Scotiabank announced a 20 million share buyback program, with both banks citing confidence in their capital generation and depressed valuations.
test_questions.quote: We also announced our intention, subject to relevant approvals, to commence a normal course issuer bid to repurchase for cancellation up to 35 million common shares (RBC) | This morning, we also announced the launch of a share buyback program for 20 million shares (Scotiabank)
test_questions.speaker: Dave McKay (CEO, RBC) / Scott Thomson (CEO, Scotiabank)

test_questions.question: What was Scotiabank's productivity ratio for International Banking in Q2 2025?
test_questions.answer: Scotiabank's International Banking achieved a productivity ratio of 51% in Q2 2025.
test_questions.quote: Our productivity ratio improved to 51%
test_questions.speaker: Scott Thomson (CEO)

test_questions.question: Which Canadian banks reported CET1 ratios above 14% in Q2 2025?
test_questions.answer: TD Bank reported the highest CET1 ratio at 14.9% in Q2 2025, while all other major Canadian banks reported CET1 ratios below 14% (RBC 13.2%, CIBC 13.4%, BMO 13.5%, Scotiabank 13.2%, NBC 13.4%).
test_questions.quote: the bank's CET1 ratio was 14.9% (TD) | We ended the quarter with a common equity tier 1 ratio of 13.2% (RBC) | coupled with a healthy CET1 ratio of 13.4% (CIBC) | Our capital position remains robust with a CET1 ratio of 13.5% (BMO) | Our CET1 ratio was 13.2% (Scotiabank) | We ended the quarter with a CET1 ratio of 13.4% (NBC)
test_questions.speaker: Raymond Chun (TD) / Dave McKay (RBC) / Victor Dodig (CIBC) / Darryl White (BMO) / Scott Thomson (Scotiabank) / Laurent Ferreira (NBC)

test_questions.question: Compare TD and National Bank's acquisition integration progress Q2 fiscal 2025
test_questions.answer: In Q2 2025, National Bank was successfully integrating CWB with $27M in synergies realized and targeting $270M by fiscal 2027, while TD was focused on AML remediation as their top priority rather than acquisition integration, spending $110M on AML remediation in Q2.
test_questions.quote: I am very pleased with the integration momentum, as well as the positive reception from clients...Funding and cost synergies are progressing ahead of schedule (National Bank) | We continue to prioritize and execute on our AML remediation and have made significant progress on our US balance sheet restructuring (TD)
test_questions.speaker: Laurent Ferreira (CEO, National Bank) / Raymond Chun (CEO, TD)

test_questions.question: CIBC vs RBC vs NBC earnings per share second quarter 2025
test_questions.answer: In Q2 2025, RBC had the highest EPS at $3.12 (adjusted), followed by NBC at $2.85, and CIBC at $2.05 (adjusted).
test_questions.quote: Adjusted diluted earnings per share of $3.12 (RBC) | We generated earnings per share of $2.85 (NBC) | earnings per share of $2.05 (CIBC)
test_questions.speaker: Katherine Gibson (CFO, RBC) / Laurent Ferreira (CEO, NBC) / Victor Dodig (CEO, CIBC)

test_questions.question: Which Canadian banks mentioned specific AI patent filings or AI achievements in Q2 2025?
test_questions.answer: TD Bank reported having over 800 AI patent filings (top 10 globally), CIBC's AI platform saved 200,000 hours during pilot phase, and Scotiabank processes 70% of commercial client emails with AI.
test_questions.quote: TD has over 800 AI patent filings (TD) | Our technology investments are paying off, including our CIBC AI platform, which has saved our team members and estimated 200,000 hours (CIBC) | over 70% of commercial client emails received by our business service center are now processed by AI (Scotiabank)
test_questions.speaker: Raymond Chun (TD) / Victor Dodig (CIBC) / Scott Thomson (Scotiabank)

test_questions.question: Which Canadian banks highlighted AI initiatives in their 2025 Q2 earnings and what were the key achievements?
test_questions.answer: Multiple banks highlighted AI initiatives in Q2 2025: TD has 800+ AI patent filings (top 10 globally), CIBC's AI platform saved 200,000 hours during pilot phase, and Scotiabank processes 70% of commercial client emails with AI. All banks are investing heavily in digital transformation and AI capabilities.
test_questions.quote: TD has over 800 AI patent filings (TD) | Our technology investments are paying off, including our CIBC AI platform, which has saved our team members and estimated 200,000 hours (CIBC) | over 70% of commercial client emails received by our business service center are now processed by AI (Scotiabank)
test_questions.speaker: Raymond Chun (TD) / Victor Dodig (CIBC) / Scott Thomson (Scotiabank)

metadata.quote_sources: Direct quotes from Q2 2025 earnings call transcripts
